intro: Heteropterys patens var. acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-tipped mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and fleshy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It attaches to host trees through haustoria, drawing water and nutrients from the host, while also performing photosynthesis. Its ecological role includes providing food for various birds and insects, contributing to forest biodiversity.
